articles.title: Two supplements shown to lower dangerously high cholesterol levels - Express
articles.description: Too much cholesterol in the body is a risk factor for life-threatening illnesses.

articles.title: Fatty liver caused by 'two' foods linked to severe neurological problems like dementia - Express
articles.description: Mounting evidence suggests a fatty liver could hinder blood flow to the brain.
articles.content: Millions of people are believed to have early-stage fatty liver disease, but most are oblivious to this fact due to a lack of symptoms. There is increasing evidence that failure to manage the conditi… [+1455 chars]

articles.title: Flu and Covid jabs to be offered in England on Christmas Day - The Guardian
articles.description: NHS makes slots available through to 27 December and urgently appeals for people to be vaccinated as hospital admissions rise
articles.content:
Dozens of sites across England will provide flu and Covid vaccinations on Christmas Day, and hundreds more are to open on Christmas Eve, Boxing Day and the bank holiday on 27 December.

articles.author: Mansur Shaheen
articles.title: One-in-ten cigarette smokers in their 40s suffer cognitive decline - Daily Mail
articles.description: A study of 136,018 participants over the age of 45 by a team at Ohio State found that 10 percent of smokers middle-aged or older suffered from memory loss and confusion.
articles.content:
Smoking cigarettes can cause a person to suffer cognitive decline in their 40s, a study finds.
